inference:
The slope of the line is $-\frac{7}{4}$, so the direction vector of the line must be parallel to the vector $\begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix}$.

The vectors $\begin{pmatrix} 7 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix}$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 14 \\ -8 \end{pmatrix}$ are parallel to $\begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix}$, so they are possible direction vectors for the line.

The vectors $\begin{pmatrix} -4/7 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}$, $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 7/4 \end{pmatrix}$, $\begin{pmatrix} -12 \\ 21 \end{pmatrix}$, $\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ -7/2 \end{pmatrix}$, and $\begin{pmatrix} -1/3 \\ 7/12 \end{pmatrix}$ are not parallel to $\begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix}$, so they are not possible direction vectors for the line.

Final Answer: \boxed{B, E}. I hope it is correct.
